Game Rewind | UK preserves streak, beats EKU

The Cats and Colonels tip off at 6 p.m. in Rupp Arena.

Game Rewind | UK preserves streak, beats EKU

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 8 p.m. EST December 7, 2014

Kentucky's Karl-Anthony Towns dunks during the first half of an NCAA college basketball game against Eastern Kentucky, Sunday, Dec. 7, 2014. (AP Photo/James Crisp)(Photo: James Crisp, AP)

12 CONNECT 11 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) for updates during the University of Kentucky's 6 p.m. Sunday basketball game against Eastern Kentucky at Rupp Arena.

Final: UK 82, EKU 49.

Karl-Anthony Towns paced the Cats with 19 points and 9 rebounds as UK, which needed a 3-pointer desperately late, sank its final three attempts from beyond the arc.

See a full box score: http://bit.ly/1zeZlg0

And watch John Calipari's postgame press conference: http://cjky.it/14zHOUo

1:52, 2H: And now the Cats can't miss. Karl-Anthony Towns lobbed in his first 3-pointer of the season, and UK's lead is 75-44.

2:55, 2H: Aaron Harrison setting up from deep beyond the 3-point line and draining a late-game shot? We've seen that. The stage wasn't so large, but Harrison sank one to continue UK's streak of making at least one in 900-plus games.

Aaron Harrison!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

— Kentucky 3pt Streak (@UK3ptstreak) December 8, 2014

3:36, 2H: Fans are calling for a 3-pointer. They got another Willie Cauley-Stein alley-oop instead. Whether the streak continues is about the only thing left to decide at the under-four timeout with UK ahead 69-43.

4:53, 2H: Three of their last four trips up the court the Cats have attempted a 3-pointer. Nothing yet. UK's 0 of 10 from beyond the arc.

Kentucky is up 26 with five minutes to play but that streak of 908 straight games with a made 3-pointer is in trouble again. Cats 0 for 10.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 8, 2014

7:59, 2H: Marcus Lee just headed to the bench and to a roar from the crowd. He dunked three times on his latest stint, including a breakaway two-hander. UK leads 60-33, led by 14 Karl-Anthony Towns points and 10 from Trey Lyles.

Former Cat Jon Hood is concerned with just one thing, though, tweeting, "Need this three..."

Need this three...

— Jon Hood (@jonnylightning4) December 8, 2014

10:21, 2H: The Rupp Arena crowd is applauding for Tim Knipp again. The EKU player went in strong to the rim and took a shot from Marcus Lee, who was called for a flagrant 1 foul. That's the less severe option. Knipp made 1 of 2 free throws, and the Colonels get the ball.

Lee called for a Flagrant 1 after hammering Knipp in the 2nd half. #BBN@KyleTucker_CJpic.twitter.com/pWMabJHfOy

— JonathanPalmer (@JonathanPalmer) December 8, 2014

11:14, 2H: Corey Walden has EKU on a mini-run, hitting back-to-back buckets into the under-12 timeout. The Colonels' star will also have a free throw after getting an and-one layup on a Devin Booker foul.

Down 56-31, though, the rest isn't so positive for EKU. The Colonels are shooting 27 percent for the game, with the domination primarily in the paint, where UK has scored 36 of its points.

Unintended consequence of fielding perhaps the tallest team in college basketball history: UK's 900+ game 3-pointer streak in jeopardy.

— Jonathan Lintner (@JonathanLintner) December 8, 2014

13:51, 2H: Throw the ball up to these UK big men and they'll find a way to get it. Marcus Lee just took a Devin Booker lob that appeared to first hit the back board -- maybe even the rim -- and flushed it. The next time up the court, those two connected again.

EKU coach Jeff Neubaurer, his team trailing 56-25, called for a fourth timeout.

14:06, 2H: Another timeout for EKU after Aaron Harrison deflected a pass, nabbed a steal and threw down a one-handed dunk at the other end. At 52-23, UK has its largest lead (29) of the game.

Instagram | @lindsaytravis15

Antoine Walker the "Y" at today's game.

15:40, 2H: John Calipari returned to the full Blue Platoon, bringing in Alex Poythress for Trey Lyles, and the lineup translated to better defense. The Cats have forced three EKU turnovers over the last 1:45 and lead 44-21 at the under-16 timeout.

17:25, 2H: UK needed some time for its first points of the half, on a Trey Lyles baseline jumper, and John Calipari mixed his platoons to get it. On the court for UK are the Harrison twins, Karl-Anthony Towns, Willie Cauley-Stein and Lyles. It's a 43-21 lead, by the way.

Kentucky has four turnovers in the first 1:45 of the second half and EKU opens on a 7-0 run to cut the deficit to 20.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 8, 2014

19:18, 2H: Timmy Knipp, a Kentucky native, scored five straight points out of the half for EKU. It's 41-19, and John Calipari called a timeout quickly to talk to Devin Booker about his defense.

20:00, 2H: The White Platoon, with Andrew Harrison rather than Trey Lyles, is out to start the second half for UK. Let the dunking commence...

Halftime: UK closed the half on a 15-0 run to lead 41-14, the fifth half this season in which they've held an opponent to fewer than 15 points.

The Cats didn't head to the locker room end without another massive alley-oop. With 1:18 left, Dominique Hawkins dished a pass above the rim, and Willie Cauley-Stein flushed it.

See a full box score: http://bit.ly/1zeZlg0

We'll carry John Calipari's postgame press conference, too: http://cjky.it/14zHOUo

#Cats lead EKU at the half, 41-14. #BBN#WeAreUKpic.twitter.com/wKk8Vlu6n5

— Adam Creech (@adameisterc1992) December 7, 2014

2:16, 1H: Friday belonged to Willie Cauley-Stein. It's Karl-Anthony Towns making all the big post plays tonight. His swat to nearly out of bounds near midcourt took the Cats to the under-four timeout with a 36-14 lead. Towns has 12 points, having made 5 of 6 shots, to go with 5 rebounds, an assist and the block.

Volleyball spike by Towns. Legit spike. Second one this year that a UK player so loaded up to demolish, could've just caught the thing.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 7, 2014

Get. It. Out. Of. Here. 12 pts, 6rebs, & 2 blks in 1st half for @KATis32 as @KentuckyMBB leads 41-14 #bbn#WeAreUKpic.twitter.com/VNJyjiuJTz

— UK Photo (@UKphotogs) December 8, 2014

3:49, 1H: UK's run is 8-0 over three minutes, during which EKU has committed three turnovers and missed all five of its shots. The Colonels, down 34-14, have called for another timeout. Meanwhile, UK's kept up momentum from a solid second half against Texas on Friday.

5:31, 1H: This may be the team that breaks UK's 3-point streak -- 900-plus straight games with at least one -- due to the Cats' size. They don't need to shoot them, and when Devin Booker pump fakes to take an open jumper instead, the chance goes up after a close call against Texas. The lead is 30-14.

7:11, 1H: John Calipari isn't happy, despite a 26-14 lead. He's used two timeouts today, the latest of which came after EKU corralled and offensive rebound and putback.

Now five assists by Andrew Harrison, running with Platoon 2 again, and Kentucky leads 26-12, 7:21 first. Cats 11-20 FG, EKU 5-22.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 7, 2014

7:21, 1H: The only thing working for EKU so far is Denzel Richardson, who has 8 points 3 of 4 shooting. The rest of the Colonels are a combined 2 of 18, and UK leads 26-12 at the under-eight timeout.

9:50, 1H: Karl-Anthony Towns has half of UK's points, with 10 on 4 of 5 shooting, and 3 rebounds as well. Three of those buckets are dunks. The Cats lead 20-12.

10:25, 1H: The Cats struck with their first alley-oop of the game on an Andrew Harrison lob to Karl-Anthony Towns. Two trips up the court later, Towns caught another one from Aaron Harrison and absorbed a foul. UK's up 19-10 at the under-12 timeout.

13:21, 1H: UK's shooting has cooled off a bit. After the 4 of 5 start, the Cats have made just 1 of their next 4. The lead is 13-7.

15:42, 1H: Heading to the under-16 timeout, it appears Dominique Hawkins will check in to play alongside of Devin Booker in Tyler Ulis' place. The Cats, who lead 9-2, are 4 of 5 from the field. Meanwhile, EKU is 1 of 10.

16:27, 1H: A correction from earlier -- EKU did have a different starting lineup, with Deverin Muff playing in place of big man Eric Stutz. According to the Colonels' Twitter feed, a star on EKU's NCAA tournament run last year is injured and not dressed.

EKU doing what it does. Three steals already from the Harrison twins. But Kentucky's defense doing what it does: allowing zilch.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 7, 2014

17:04, 1H: Timeout, EKU. The Colonels got a bucket on a Ja'Mill Powell layup, but the next time up the court Corey Walden air-balled a 3-pointer. Coach Jeff Neubaurer is searching for some offense. UK leads 7-2.

18:13, 1H: It's going to be another of those games where UK's lengthy defense bothers. EKU is off to an 0 for 4 shooting start and trails 5-0.

19:46, 1H: It took Aaron Harrison all of 14 seconds to get UK on the board with a layup. And we're underway...

Instagram | @lindsaytravis15

Introductions at Rupp with the traditional fireworks. UK vs EKU starts now. #seeblue #WeAreUK #UKvsEKU

20:00, 1H: There aren't any surprises in either starting lineup tonight, but we'll see who spells Tyler Ulis when it's time to substitute.

SEC Network analyst Darrin Horn said pregame that he wants to see the Cats come out with the same energy they showcased in the second half of the Texas game.

"The second thing is, we've got to get better at executing half court offense," said Horn, the Kentucky native and former WKU head coach. "That's what I'm telling my team if I'm John Calipari."

Not a great game for Ulis to be out sick. EKU second in the nation in steals. Andrew Harrison needs to be sharp.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 7, 2014

PREGAME: Two days after pulling away in the second half to beat Texas, UK's back to host an EKU team that's coming off an NCAA tournament appearance.

The Cats will be one player short, though.

"Tyler (Ulis) is not feeling well so we are going to hold him out for today's game," coach John Calipari tweeted before the game.

Ulis is the second UK player to miss a game due to illness, following teammate Alex Poythress. It's unknown who will take his place in the White (second) Platoon.

For some pregame reading, check out a preview by beat writer Kyle Tucker focusing on UK's offensive tuneups (http://cjky.it/1u8IwND) as well as story lines and stats (http://cjky.it/15XI1S9).

UK Platoon 1 (Blue)

G Andrew Harrison

G Aaron Harris

F Alex Poythress

F Willie Cauley-Stein

F Karl-Anthony Towns

UK Platoon 2 (White)

G Unknown

G Devin Booker

F Trey Lyles

F Marcus Lee

C Dakari Johnson

Projected EKU Starters

G Corey Walden

G Isaac McGlone

G Timmy Knipp

G Ja'Mill Powell

F Eric Stutz
